content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `keep_only_names` which iterates over the provided list of words (`words`) and removes all words that do not start with a capital letter (eg, remove "dog" but keep "Dog").

Here is a simple solution in Julia:

```julia
function keep_only_names(words)
    filter(x -> x[1] == uppercase(x[1]), words)
end
```
This function uses the built-in `filter` function to iterate over each word in the list and only keeps those that start with a capital letter. The condition `x[1] == uppercase(x[1])` checks if the first character of the string is the same as its uppercase version, which will be true for words starting with a capital letter.
